result.execSummary:
The defendant Adrian Tlahuel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 fine plus costs. (fine and costs have been paid in full from cash bond posted)
10 days stayed as fine/costs paid in full from cash bond posted. Credit for time served. (Time served sentence)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adrian Tlahuel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adrian Tlahuel in court with attorney Shawn Xiong Thao.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea. Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

$150 has already been posted, defendant needs to post an additional $500 to be released from jail. Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.

ADDRESS INFO for Adrian Tlahuel
Current: 710 Hubbard St., Green Bay, WI 54303   (Effective: 08-10-2015)
Prior: 1405 Day St, Green Bay, WI 54302

Defendant Adrian Tlahuel appears by video conference from the Door County Jail.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on missed court appearance. Defendant indicates he didn't have a ride and thought his attorney would take care of the matter without him having to appear in court. State request additional cash be posted. Court agrees with State that some additional cash should be posted, increases cash bond to $650. Same conditions apply.  Status 8/17/15 at 10:00 AM.

Defendants brother called to say defendant was in the Brown County Jail. Wondered when he would be transferred to Door County. Clerk LS told brother she had no idea when defendant would be transferred. Told brother to have defendant contact his atty.

Attorney Shawn Xiong Thao in court.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions Atty Thao on defendants whereabout. Atty Thao indicates he hasn't been able to get ahold of the defendant, has no other information. State requests bench warrant. Court orders bench warrant.

Defendant Adrian Tlahuel in court with attorney Shawn Thao.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Bond remains in effect. Defendant Adrian Tlahuel in court with attorney Shawn Xiong Thao.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Adrian Tlahuel appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on why he's not present in court in person. Defendant advises he doesn't have a license and didn't have a ride to court today. Defendant indicates he's talked to an attorney and needs time to get the retainer fee together. Court reschedules matter, indicates defendant needs to be in court in person on 6/22/15. Bond remains in effect.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant called JA Ripp wanting to reschedule 5/22/15 appearance because he didn't have a ride to court.
Defendant called COC, was advised of date and time for next hearing.
Defendant was fingerprinted 4/27/15 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 8/21/15)
Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Adrian Tlahuel in court, in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel.  Defendant does not wish to have an attorney represent him. State gives recommendation on bond. Defendant is currently serving sentence in underlying case, court encourages defendant to contact PD office to see if he qualifies for their representation. Bond set.  AIA 5/22/15 at 10:00 AM.
